CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 3, 1970, pg. 1, reads: "NEWEST BLACK JUDGE - Atty. Henry R. Smith, State president of NAACP is sworn into office as the third Allegheny County Black Common Pleas Court Judge Monday by Common Pleas Court Judge Homer S. Brown, who became the country's first black judge in late 1950's and who was also at the time president of the Pittsburgh NAACP branch. In right photo are members of Judge Smith's family, left to right: Judge Smith, his son Leslie, his wife, Mrs. Margaret Smith; his son, Daryl, holding his granddaughter, Michelle, 2; and his daughter, Camillo. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Newly appointed Common Pleas Court Judge Henry R. Smith, Leslie Smith, Margaret Smith, Daryl Smith holding Michelle Smith, and Camillo Smith, posed in office
